column4: is it possible for a new user like me to set a wireless network in Ubuntu 9.10?
i already have a dual boot system Ubuntu and Vista
but my network and wireless do not work in Ubuntu
try network manager : apt-get install network-manager
dont forget to sudo it : sudo apt-get install network-manager, you can list available packages for a front end using : sudo apt-cache search network-manager
now you can configure it by right clicking it -> "edit connections" -> Wireless tab -> Add -> IPv4 settings ... and you should be ok :)
activate your wireless (in case you have to switch a button on/off) than reboot
i suppose you're using Gnome, go to System -> Preferences -> Network connections -> click on Wireless tab -> click Add -> go to IPv4 settings
have a web browser handy and a terminal to test if it's not already connected!
no, do you know if your modem is using dhcp? cause i assumed you have to configure your connection parameters manually
well, open a terminal and ping google.com than waitt 5sec and abort using key combination Ctrl+c
use pastebin.com to show me the output if you don't know what it means :)
no, just few seconds :)
everything is ok ;) just use your browser
like you got pastebin.com!!!
yep, try and tell me :)
once undocked your laptop can't connect wireless while it does under vista, is that what you're telling me?
wich release of ubuntu are you running?
i assume you're using Gnome, click on the icon of the network-manager and tell me if it lists connections once you undock your laptop
sorry man, i can't get things clear!!! http://www.dedoimedo.com/computers/wireless-t61.html
what's your laptop brand/model?
try this command and pastebin as usual : sudo ifconfig
http://paste.ubuntu.com/377021/
now execute : sudo route and pastebin
i did a little screenshot thay may help you, wait a minute
i will be here for another 15 minutes or so then i will be back in 2 hours
is your wifi working out of the dock now?
try a manul config like in the snapshot
i am experiencing problems with the popupwindows
here is the file one more time, if you still experience problems i'll send it another way
do a find -name wlan_config.png in your home directory
I gues it did not get saved because i read failed in one of the windows
hold on, i'll upload it somewhere else and give you a link
this is all so new that i turn around and i am confused
you'll get it right the next time, keep trying ;)
http://www.filesavr.com/wlanconfig
got it
i cannot apply the button does not get activated
which one, which step?
last step
did you clicked button 8 first?
yes
all the date is ther, entered but the button remains greyed out
may you give me a screenshot like mine plz?
i will try to do that
sorry i dont have my Snagit and cannot easily capture just that monitor alone
ok i found the ubuntu snagit, where do i send the file to?
try these commad lines : "sudo ifconfig wlan0 192.168.15.101 netmask 255.255.255.0 broadcast 192.168.15.255 up" than "route add default gw 192168.15.1"
oups! don't forget to sudo the second one as well
sudo route add default gw 192.168.15.1
i do not know how to sudo it, sorry i am only 3 weeks old
i just corrected :)
you mean in a terminal ok
yep
thanks
should i now test it?
yep
ok see you later maybe and thank you
still as before
you were not able to connect with the command line?
you mean i was suppose to do that when not docked in?
yep
my memory is not that good
take care ;) just try and tell me what you did and what you got
i undocked, then i tried access to internet without success then
i opened a terminal and scrolled through the last commands in ther and repeated the ones you gave me, without success
now i am ready to succeed
go ahead
why did it not let me save the info ?
you may not have permissions :)
that screen is still empty, the ipv4 screen
i am the only owner
aha! you should fill it!
remember i cannot save after i fill it
running around in circle, catch 22
should i try the other option on that screen: auto addresses only (DHCP)
then fill in the DNS, Domain, ID
just keep in mind : the button wont activate until you enter sufficient valid data
ok then that probably means that there was another field that i did not filled in the third screen where number 8 is
let me redo it all over
if i can find your png file again lol
it may be on any windows where the button is unclickable
it's still at the same url : http://www.filesavr.com/wlanconfig
i'll be back in a min :)

lucky ;)

just google with different keywords till you find a solution ;)

use your ethernet interface rather than using usb!
